00052 static struct ptlrpc_sec_policy null_policy;
00053 static struct ptlrpc_sec        null_sec;
00054 static struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx    null_cli_ctx;
00055 static struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx    null_svc_ctx;
00056 
00057 /*
00058  * we can temporarily use the topmost 8-bits of lm_secflvr to identify
00059  * the source sec part.
00060  */
00061 static inline
00062 void null_encode_sec_part(struct lustre_msg *msg, enum lustre_sec_part sp)
00063 {
00064         msg->lm_secflvr |= (((__u32) sp) & 0xFF) << 24;
00065 }
00066 
00067 static inline
00068 enum lustre_sec_part null_decode_sec_part(struct lustre_msg *msg)
00069 {
00070         return (msg->lm_secflvr >> 24) & 0xFF;
00071 }
00072 
00073 static int null_ctx_refresh(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00074 {
00075         /* should never reach here */
00076         LBUG();
00077         return 0;
00078 }
00079 
00080 static
00081 int null_ctx_sign(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00082 {
00083         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_secflvr = SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL;
00084 
00085         if (!req->rq_import->imp_dlm_fake) {
00086                 struct obd_device *obd = req->rq_import->imp_obd;
00087                 null_encode_sec_part(req->rq_reqbuf,
00088                                      obd->u.cli.cl_sp_me);
00089         }
00090         req->rq_reqdata_len = req->rq_reqlen;
00091         return 0;
00092 }
00093 
00094 static
00095 int null_ctx_verify(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00096 {
00097         __u32   cksums, cksumc;
00098 
00099         LASSERT(req->rq_repdata);
00100 
00101         req->rq_repmsg = req->rq_repdata;
00102         req->rq_replen = req->rq_repdata_len;
00103 
00104         if (req->rq_early) {
00105                 cksums = lustre_msg_get_cksum(req->rq_repdata);
00106                 cksumc = lustre_msg_calc_cksum(req->rq_repmsg);
00107 
00108                 if (cksumc != cksums) {
00109                         CDEBUG(D_SEC,
00110                                "early reply checksum mismatch: %08x != %08x\n",
00111                                cksumc, cksums);
00112                         return -EINVAL;
00113                 }
00114         }
00115 
00116         return 0;
00117 }
00118 
00119 static
00120 struct ptlrpc_sec *null_create_sec(struct obd_import *imp,
00121                                    struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *svc_ctx,
00122                                    struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
00123 {
00124         LASSERT(SPTLRPC_FLVR_POLICY(sf->sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_POLICY_NULL);
00125 
00126         /* general layer has take a module reference for us, because we never
00127          * really destroy the sec, simply release the reference here.
00128          */
00129         sptlrpc_policy_put(&null_policy);
00130         return &null_sec;
00131 }
00132 
00133 static
00134 void null_destroy_sec(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
00135 {
00136         LASSERT(sec == &null_sec);
00137 }
00138 
00139 static
00140 struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *null_lookup_ctx(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00141                                        struct vfs_cred *vcred,
00142                                        int create, int remove_dead)
00143 {
00144         atomic_inc(&null_cli_ctx.cc_refcount);
00145         return &null_cli_ctx;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static
00149 int null_flush_ctx_cache(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00150                          uid_t uid,
00151                          int grace, int force)
00152 {
00153         return 0;
00154 }
00155 
00156 static
00157 int null_alloc_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00158                       struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00159                       int msgsize)
00160 {
00161         if (!req->rq_reqbuf) {
00162                 int alloc_size = size_roundup_power2(msgsize);
00163 
00164                 LASSERT(!req->rq_pool);
00165                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, alloc_size);
00166                 if (!req->rq_reqbuf)
00167                         return -ENOMEM;
00168 
00169                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = alloc_size;
00170         } else {
00171                 LASSERT(req->rq_pool);
00172                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= msgsize);
00173                 memset(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, msgsize);
00174         }
00175 
00176         req->rq_reqmsg = req->rq_reqbuf;
00177         return 0;
00178 }
00179 
00180 static
00181 void null_free_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00182                       struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00183 {
00184         if (!req->rq_pool) {
00185                 LASSERTF(req->rq_reqmsg == req->rq_reqbuf,
00186                          "req %p: reqmsg %p is not reqbuf %p in null sec\n",
00187                          req, req->rq_reqmsg, req->rq_reqbuf);
00188                 LASSERTF(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= req->rq_reqlen,
00189                          "req %p: reqlen %d should smaller than buflen %d\n",
00190                          req, req->rq_reqlen, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00191 
00192                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00193                 req->rq_reqbuf = NULL;
00194                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = 0;
00195         }
00196 }
00197 
00198 static
00199 int null_alloc_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00200                       struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00201                       int msgsize)
00202 {
00203         /* add space for early replied */
00204         msgsize += lustre_msg_early_size();
00205 
00206         msgsize = size_roundup_power2(msgsize);
00207 
00208         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_repbuf, msgsize);
00209         if (!req->rq_repbuf)
00210                 return -ENOMEM;
00211 
00212         req->rq_repbuf_len = msgsize;
00213         return 0;
00214 }
00215 
00216 static
00217 void null_free_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00218                       struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00219 {
00220         LASSERT(req->rq_repbuf);
00221 
00222         OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_repbuf, req->rq_repbuf_len);
00223         req->rq_repbuf = NULL;
00224         req->rq_repbuf_len = 0;
00225 }
00226 
00227 static
00228 int null_enlarge_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
00229                         struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00230                         int segment, int newsize)
00231 {
00232         struct lustre_msg      *newbuf;
00233         struct lustre_msg      *oldbuf = req->rq_reqmsg;
00234         int                     oldsize, newmsg_size, alloc_size;
00235 
00236         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
00237         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf == req->rq_reqmsg);
00238         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= req->rq_reqlen);
00239         LASSERT(req->rq_reqlen == lustre_packed_msg_size(oldbuf));
00240 
00241         /* compute new message size */
00242         oldsize = req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[segment];
00243         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[segment] = newsize;
00244         newmsg_size = lustre_packed_msg_size(oldbuf);
00245         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[segment] = oldsize;
00246 
00247         /* request from pool should always have enough buffer */
00248         LASSERT(!req->rq_pool || req->rq_reqbuf_len >= newmsg_size);
00249 
00250         if (req->rq_reqbuf_len < newmsg_size) {
00251                 alloc_size = size_roundup_power2(newmsg_size);
00252 
00253                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(newbuf, alloc_size);
00254                 if (newbuf == NULL)
00255                         return -ENOMEM;
00256 
00257                 /* Must lock this, so that otherwise unprotected change of
00258                  * rq_reqmsg is not racing with parallel processing of
00259                  * imp_replay_list traversing threads. See LU-3333
00260                  * This is a bandaid at best, we really need to deal with this
00261                  * in request enlarging code before unpacking that's already
00262                  * there */
00263                 if (req->rq_import)
00264                         spin_lock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
00265                 memcpy(newbuf, req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqlen);
00266 
00267                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00268                 req->rq_reqbuf = req->rq_reqmsg = newbuf;
00269                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = alloc_size;
00270 
00271                 if (req->rq_import)
00272                         spin_unlock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
00273         }
00274 
00275         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqmsg, segment, newsize);
00276         req->rq_reqlen = newmsg_size;
00277 
00278         return 0;
00279 }
00280 
00281 static struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx null_svc_ctx = {
00282         .sc_refcount    = ATOMIC_INIT(1),
00283         .sc_policy      = &null_policy,
00284 };
00285 
00286 static
00287 int null_accept(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00288 {
00289         LASSERT(SPTLRPC_FLVR_POLICY(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc) ==
00290                 SPTLRPC_POLICY_NULL);
00291 
00292         if (req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc != SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL) {
00293                 CERROR("Invalid rpc flavor 0x%x\n", req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
00294                 return SECSVC_DROP;
00295         }
00296 
00297         req->rq_sp_from = null_decode_sec_part(req->rq_reqbuf);
00298 
00299         req->rq_reqmsg = req->rq_reqbuf;
00300         req->rq_reqlen = req->rq_reqdata_len;
00301 
00302         req->rq_svc_ctx = &null_svc_ctx;
00303         atomic_inc(&req->rq_svc_ctx->sc_refcount);
00304 
00305         return SECSVC_OK;
00306 }
00307 
00308 static
00309 int null_alloc_rs(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int msgsize)
00310 {
00311         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs;
00312         int rs_size = sizeof(*rs) + msgsize;
00313 
00314         LASSERT(msgsize % 8 == 0);
00315 
00316         rs = req->rq_reply_state;
00317 
00318         if (rs) {
00319                 /* pre-allocated */
00320                 LASSERT(rs->rs_size >= rs_size);
00321         } else {
00322                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(rs, rs_size);
00323                 if (rs == NULL)
00324                         return -ENOMEM;
00325 
00326                 rs->rs_size = rs_size;
00327         }
00328 
00329         rs->rs_svc_ctx = req->rq_svc_ctx;
00330         atomic_inc(&req->rq_svc_ctx->sc_refcount);
00331 
00332         rs->rs_repbuf = (struct lustre_msg *) (rs + 1);
00333         rs->rs_repbuf_len = rs_size - sizeof(*rs);
00334         rs->rs_msg = rs->rs_repbuf;
00335 
00336         req->rq_reply_state = rs;
00337         return 0;
00338 }
00339 
00340 static
00341 void null_free_rs(struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs)
00342 {
00343         LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT(&rs->rs_svc_ctx->sc_refcount, 1);
00344         atomic_dec(&rs->rs_svc_ctx->sc_refcount);
00345 
00346         if (!rs->rs_prealloc)
00347                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(rs, rs->rs_size);
00348 }
00349 
00350 static
00351 int null_authorize(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00352 {
00353         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs = req->rq_reply_state;
00354 
00355         LASSERT(rs);
00356 
00357         rs->rs_repbuf->lm_secflvr = SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL;
00358         rs->rs_repdata_len = req->rq_replen;
00359 
00360         if (likely(req->rq_packed_final)) {
00361                 if (lustre_msghdr_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT)
00362                         req->rq_reply_off = lustre_msg_early_size();
00363                 else
00364                         req->rq_reply_off = 0;
00365         } else {
00366                 __u32 cksum;
00367 
00368                 cksum = lustre_msg_calc_cksum(rs->rs_repbuf);
00369                 lustre_msg_set_cksum(rs->rs_repbuf, cksum);
00370                 req->rq_reply_off = 0;
00371         }
00372 
00373         return 0;
00374 }
00375 
00376 static struct ptlrpc_ctx_ops null_ctx_ops = {
00377         .refresh                = null_ctx_refresh,
00378         .sign                   = null_ctx_sign,
00379         .verify                 = null_ctx_verify,
00380 };
00381 
00382 static struct ptlrpc_sec_cops null_sec_cops = {
00383         .create_sec             = null_create_sec,
00384         .destroy_sec            = null_destroy_sec,
00385         .lookup_ctx             = null_lookup_ctx,
00386         .flush_ctx_cache        = null_flush_ctx_cache,
00387         .alloc_reqbuf           = null_alloc_reqbuf,
00388         .alloc_repbuf           = null_alloc_repbuf,
00389         .free_reqbuf            = null_free_reqbuf,
00390         .free_repbuf            = null_free_repbuf,
00391         .enlarge_reqbuf         = null_enlarge_reqbuf,
00392 };
00393 
00394 static struct ptlrpc_sec_sops null_sec_sops = {
00395         .accept                 = null_accept,
00396         .alloc_rs               = null_alloc_rs,
00397         .authorize              = null_authorize,
00398         .free_rs                = null_free_rs,
00399 };
00400 
00401 static struct ptlrpc_sec_policy null_policy = {
00402         .sp_owner               = THIS_MODULE,
00403         .sp_name                = "sec.null",
00404         .sp_policy              = SPTLRPC_POLICY_NULL,
00405         .sp_cops                = &null_sec_cops,
00406         .sp_sops                = &null_sec_sops,
00407 };
00408 
00409 static void null_init_internal(void)
00410 {
00411         static HLIST_HEAD(__list);
00412 
00413         null_sec.ps_policy = &null_policy;
00414         atomic_set(&null_sec.ps_refcount, 1);   /* always busy */
00415         null_sec.ps_id = -1;
00416         null_sec.ps_import = NULL;
00417         null_sec.ps_flvr.sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_NULL;
00418         null_sec.ps_flvr.sf_flags = 0;
00419         null_sec.ps_part = LUSTRE_SP_ANY;
00420         null_sec.ps_dying = 0;
00421         spin_lock_init(&null_sec.ps_lock);
00422         atomic_set(&null_sec.ps_nctx, 1);       /* for "null_cli_ctx" */
00423         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&null_sec.ps_gc_list);
00424         null_sec.ps_gc_interval = 0;
00425         null_sec.ps_gc_next = 0;
00426 
00427         hlist_add_head(&null_cli_ctx.cc_cache, &__list);
00428         atomic_set(&null_cli_ctx.cc_refcount, 1);       /* for hash */
00429         null_cli_ctx.cc_sec = &null_sec;
00430         null_cli_ctx.cc_ops = &null_ctx_ops;
00431         null_cli_ctx.cc_expire = 0;
00432         null_cli_ctx.cc_flags = PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED | PTLRPC_CTX_ETERNAL |
00433                                 PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE;
00434         null_cli_ctx.cc_vcred.vc_uid = 0;
00435         spin_lock_init(&null_cli_ctx.cc_lock);
00436         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&null_cli_ctx.cc_req_list);
00437         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&null_cli_ctx.cc_gc_chain);
00438 }
00439 
00440 int sptlrpc_null_init(void)
00441 {
00442         int rc;
00443 
00444         null_init_internal();
00445 
00446         rc = sptlrpc_register_policy(&null_policy);
00447         if (rc)
00448                 CERROR("failed to register %s: %d\n", null_policy.sp_name, rc);
00449 
00450         return rc;
00451 }
00452 
00453 void sptlrpc_null_fini(void)
00454 {
00455         int rc;
00456 
00457         rc = sptlrpc_unregister_policy(&null_policy);
00458         if (rc)
00459                 CERROR("failed to unregister %s: %d\n", null_policy.sp_name,rc);
00460 }
